nodes.bodyText: This should have its own test, and maybe its own ticket too.

The ParseSyntheticTest is actually already containing that test.
Would that be ok?
I have added a separate CQL text validating the expressions structure/order.

So this builds the final result and checks the default values for env are respected?
I would also verify that the ColorMap/ColorMapEntries have the expected structure, similar to the one we'd get out of a SLD parse.

Yep. it does 2 passes.
one checking for the default value and one right after having set some ENV values so that the result get different.
I have updated the test to check that the colormap has the expected structure.
